v-class-icon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-code/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-col/cols.description: Sets the default number of columns the component extends. Available options are: **1 -> 12** and **auto**.

v-col/sm.description: Changes the number of columns on small and greater breakpoints.

v-col/md.description: Changes the number of columns on medium and greater breakpoints.

v-col/lg.description: Changes the number of columns on large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/xl.description: Changes the number of columns on extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/xxl.description: Changes the number of columns on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/offset.description: Sets the default offset for the column.

v-col/offset-sm.description: Changes the offset of the component on small and greater breakpoints.

v-col/offset-md.description: Changes the offset of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.

v-col/offset-lg.description: Changes the offset of the component on large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/offset-xl.description: Changes the offset of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/offset-xxl.description: Changes the offset of the component on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/order.description: Sets the default [order](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/order) for the column.

v-col/order-sm.description: Changes the order of the component on small and greater breakpoints.

v-col/order-md.description: Changes the order of the component on medium and greater breakpoints.

v-col/order-lg.description: Changes the order of the component on large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/order-xl.description: Changes the order of the component on extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/order-xxl.description: Changes the order of the component on extra extra large and greater breakpoints.

v-col/align-self.description: Applies the [align-items](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/align-items) css property. Available options are: **start**, **center**, **end**, **auto**, **baseline** and **stretch**.

v-col/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-color-picker/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

v-color-picker/dot-size.description: Changes the size of the selection dot on the canvas.

v-color-picker/mode.description: The current selected input type. Syncable with `v-model:mode`.

v-color-picker/swatches-max-height.description: Sets the maximum height of the swatches section.

v-color-picker/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-color-picker/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-color-picker/width.description: Sets the width of the color picker.

v-color-picker/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-color-picker/position.description: Sets the position for the component.

v-color-picker/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-color-picker/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-color-picker/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-color-picker/swatches.description: Sets the available color swatches to select from. 2D array of rows and columns, accepts any color format the picker does.

v-combobox/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

v-combobox/auto-select-first.description: When searching, will always highlight the first option and select it on blur. `exact` will only highlight and select exact matches.

v-combobox/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

v-combobox/custom-filter.description: Function used to filter items, called for each filterable key on each item in the list. The first argument is the filterable value from the item, the second is the search term, and the third is the internal item object. The function should return true if the item should be included in the filtered list, or the index of the match in the value if it should be included with the result highlighted.

v-combobox/flat.description: Removes box shadow when using a variant with elevation.

v-combobox/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

v-combobox/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

v-combobox/chips.description: Changes display of selections to chips.

v-combobox/closable-chips.description: Enables the [closable](/api/v-chip/#props-closable) prop on all [v-chip](/components/chips/) components.

v-combobox/close-text.description: Text set to to the inputs `aria-label` and `title` when input menu is closed.

v-combobox/open-text.description: Text set to to the inputs **aria-label** and **title** when input menu is open.

v-combobox/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-combobox/hide-no-data.description: Hides the menu when there are no options to show.  Useful for preventing the menu from opening before results are fetched asynchronously.  Also has the effect of opening the menu when the `items` array changes if not already open.

v-combobox/hide-selected.description: Do not display in the select menu items that are already selected.

v-combobox/menu.description: Renders with the menu open by default.

v-combobox/menu-props.description: Pass props through to the `v-menu` component. Accepts an object with anything from [v-menu](/api/v-menu/#props) props, camelCase keys are recommended.

v-combobox/id.description: Sets the DOM id on the component.

v-combobox/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the input.

v-combobox/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-combobox/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-combobox/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-combobox/multiple.description: Changes select to multiple. Accepts array for value.

v-combobox/no-data-text.description: Text shown when no items are provided to the component.

v-combobox/open-on-clear.description: Open's the menu whenever the clear icon is clicked.

v-combobox/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have **title** and **value** properties, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props). Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, and **item-props** props.

v-combobox/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

v-combobox/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

v-combobox/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children.

v-combobox/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

v-combobox/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

v-combobox/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

v-combobox/counter.description: Creates counter for input length; if no number is specified, it defaults to 25. Does not apply any validation.

v-combobox/persistent-placeholder.description: Forces placeholder to always be visible.

v-combobox/persistent-counter.description: Forces counter to always be visible.

v-combobox/role.description: The role attribute applied to the input.

v-combobox/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

v-combobox/center-affix.description: Vertically align **appendInner**, **prependInner**, **clearIcon** and **label** in the center.

v-combobox/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the outnside the component's input, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

v-combobox/hide-spin-buttons.description: Hides spin buttons on the input when type is set to `number`.

v-combobox/hint.description: Displays hint text below the input when focused. Force this always open with the [persistent-hint](#props-persistent-hint) property.

v-combobox/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

v-combobox/direction.description: Changes the direction of the input.

v-combobox/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-combobox/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

v-combobox/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

v-combobox/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-combobox/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

v-combobox/validate-on.type:
| 'lazy'
  | 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
v-combobox/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-combobox/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-combobox/hide-details.description: Hides hint and validation errors. When set to `auto` messages will be rendered only if there's a message (hint, error message, counter value etc) to display.

v-combobox/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-combobox/clearable.description: Allows for the component to be cleared.

v-combobox/clear-icon.description: The icon used when the **clearable** prop is set to true.

v-combobox/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

v-combobox/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-combobox/base-color.description: Sets the color of the input when it is not focused.

v-combobox/persistent-clear.description: Always show the clearable icon when the input is dirty (By default it only shows on hover).

v-combobox/prepend-inner-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend-inner** slot.

v-combobox/single-line.description: Label does not move on focus/dirty.

v-combobox/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

v-combobox/loading.description: Displays linear progress bar. Can either be a String which specifies which color is applied to the progress bar (any material color or theme color - **primary**, **secondary**, **success**, **info**, **warning**, **error**) or a Boolean which uses the component **color** (set by color prop - if it's supported by the component) or the primary color.

v-combobox/rounded.description: Adds a border radius to the input.

v-combobox/counter-value.description: Function returns the counter display text.

v-combobox/delimiters.description: Accepts an array of strings that will trigger a new tag when typing. Does not replace the normal Tab and Enter keys.

v-component-icon/icon.description: Apply a specific icon using the [v-icon](/components/icons/) component.

v-component-icon/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-confirm-edit/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-confirm-edit/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-container/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-counter/active.description: Determines whether the counter is visible or not.

| { component: Component }
  | string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
v-counter/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-data-iterator/search.description: Text input used to filter items.

v-data-iterator/loading.description: If `true` and no items are provided, then a loading text will be shown.

v-data-iterator/items.description: An array of strings or objects used for automatically generating children components.

v-data-iterator/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

v-data-iterator/item-selectable.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains the boolean value indicating if the item is selectable.

v-data-iterator/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

v-data-iterator/show-select.description: Shows the column with checkboxes for selecting items in the list.

v-data-iterator/select-strategy.description: Defines the strategy of selecting items in the list. Possible values are: 'single' (only one item can be selected at a time), 'page' ('Select all' button will select only items on the current page), 'all' ('Select all' button will select all items in the list).

v-data-iterator/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-data-iterator/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

v-data-iterator/sort-by.description: Changes which item property (or properties) should be used for sort order. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

v-data-iterator/multi-sort.description: If `true` then one can sort on multiple properties.

v-data-iterator/must-sort.description: If `true` then one can not disable sorting, it will always switch between ascending and descending.

v-data-iterator/custom-key-sort.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customSort` is skipped for columns with `customKeySort` specified.

v-data-iterator/items-per-page.description: Changes how many items per page should be visible. Can be used with `.sync` modifier. Setting this prop to `-1` will display all items on the page.

v-data-iterator/expand-on-click.description: Expands item when the row is clicked.

v-data-iterator/expanded.description: Array of expanded items. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

v-data-iterator/group-by.description: Changes which item property should be used for grouping items. Currently only supports a single grouping in the format: `group` or `['group']`. When using an array, only the first element is considered. Can be used with `.sync` modifier.

v-data-iterator/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

v-data-iterator/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

v-data-iterator/filter-keys.description: Array of specific keys to filter on the item.

v-data-iterator/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-data-table/filter-mode.description:
Controls how the results of `customFilter` and `customKeyFilter` are combined. All modes only apply `customFilter` to columns not specified in `customKeyFilter`.

- **some**: There is at least one match from either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **every**: All columns match either the custom filter or the custom key filter.
- **union**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, or all columns match the custom key filters.
- **intersection**: There is at least one match from the custom filter, and all columns match the custom key filters.

v-data-table/custom-key-filter.description: Function used on specific keys within the item object. `customFilter` is skipped for columns with `customKeyFilter` specified.

v-dialog/retain-focus.description: Tab focus will return to the first child of the dialog by default. Disable this when using external tools that require focus such as TinyMCE or vue-clipboard.

v-dialog/absolute.description: Applies **position: absolute** to the content element.

v-dialog/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-dialog/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

v-dialog/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

v-img/lazy-src.description:
Something to show while waiting for the main image to load, typically a small base64-encoded thumbnail. Has a slight blur filter applied.

Use [vuetify-loader](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify-loader) to generate automatically. NOTE: This prop has no effect unless either `height` or `aspect-ratio` are provided.

v-img/aspect-ratio.description: Calculated as `width/height`, so for a 1920x1080px image this will be `1.7778`. Will be calculated automatically if omitted.

v-list/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

v-list/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it is in an active state.

v-list/bg-color.description: Applies specified color to the control's background. Used on components that also support the **color** prop. - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-list/disabled.description: Puts all children inputs into a disabled state.

v-list/lines.description: Designates a **minimum-height** for all children `v-list-item` components. This prop uses [line-clamp](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-line-clamp) and is not supported in all browsers.

v-list/nav.description: An alternative styling that reduces `v-list-item` width and rounds the corners. Typically used with **[v-navigation-drawer](/components/navigation-drawers)**.

v-list/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

v-list/select-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when selected.
- **leaf:** Only leaf nodes (items without children) can be selected.
- **independent:** All nodes can be selected whether they have children or not.
- **classic:** Selecting a parent node will cause all children to be selected, parent nodes will be displayed as selected if all their descendants are selected. Only leaf nodes will be added to the model.

v-list/open-strategy.description:
Affects how items with children behave when expanded.
- **multiple:** Any number of groups can be open at once.
- **single:** Only one group at each level can be open, opening a group will cause others to close.
- **list:** Multiple, but all other groups will close when an item is selected.

v-list/opened.description: An array containing the values of currently opened groups. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:opened`.

v-list/selected.description: An array containing the values of currently selected items. Can be two-way bound with `v-model:selected`.

v-list/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-list/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-list/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-list/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-list/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-list/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-list/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-list/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-list/items.description: Can be an array of objects or strings. By default objects should have a **title** property, and can optionally have a **props** property containing any [VListItem props](/api/v-list-item/#props), a **value** property to allow selection, and a **children** property containing more item objects. Keys to use for these can be changed with the **item-title**, **item-value**, **item-props**, and **item-children** props.

v-list/item-title.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its title.

v-list/item-value.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its value.

v-list/item-children.description: Property on supplied `items` that contains its children.

v-list/item-props.description: Props object that will be applied to each item component. `true` will treat the original object as raw props and pass it directly to the component.

v-list/return-object.description: Changes the selection behavior to return the object directly rather than the value specified with **item-value**.

v-list/value-comparator.description: Apply a custom comparison algorithm to compare **model-value** and values contains in the **items** prop.

v-list/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-list/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-list/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-list/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

v-list-group/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

v-list-group/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-list-group/prepend-icon.description: Prepends an icon to the component, uses the same syntax as `v-icon`.

v-list-group/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

v-list-group/title.description: Specify a title text for the component.

v-list-group/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list-img/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list-item/title.description: Generates a `v-list-item-title` component with the supplied value. Note that this overrides the native [`title`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/title) attribute, that must be set with `v-bind:title.attr` instead.

v-list-item/subtitle.description: Specify a subtitle text for the component.

v-list-item/active.description: Controls the **active** state of the item. This is typically used to highlight the component.

v-list-item/active-class.description: The class applied to the component when it matches the current route. Find more information about the [active-class prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#active-class) on the [vue-router](https://router.vuejs.org/) documentation.

v-list-item/active-color.description: The applied color when the component is in an active state.

v-list-item/append-avatar.description: Appends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

v-list-item/append-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component after default content in the **append** slot.

v-list-item/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

v-list-item/link.description: Designates that the component is a link. This is automatic when using the href or to prop.

v-list-item/prepend-avatar.description: Prepends a [v-avatar](/components/avatars/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

v-list-item/prepend-icon.description: Creates a [v-icon](/api/v-icon/) component in the **prepend** slot before default content.

v-list-item/density.description: Adjusts the vertical height used by the component.

v-list-item/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-list-item/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-list-item/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-list-item/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-list-item/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-list-item/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-list-item/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-list-item/href.description: Designates the component as anchor and applies the **href** attribute.

v-list-item/replace.description: Setting **replace** prop will call `router.replace()` instead of `router.push()` when clicked, so the navigation will not leave a history record. You can find more information about the [replace](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#replace) prop on the vue-router documentation.

v-list-item/exact.description: Exactly match the link. Without this, '/' will match every route. You can find more information about the [**exact** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#exact) on the vue-router documentation.

v-list-item/to.description: Denotes the target route of the link. You can find more information about the [**to** prop](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#to) on the vue-router documentation.

v-list-item/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-list-item/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-list-item/color.description: Applies specified color to the control when in an **active** state or **input-value** is **true** - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors),

v-list-item/variant.description: Applies a distinct style to the component.

v-list-item-action/end.description: Applies margin at the start of the component.

v-list-item-media/start.description: Applies margin at the end of the component.

v-menu/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-menu/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

v-menu/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

v-menu/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

v-menu/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

v-menu/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

v-menu/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-menu/persistent.description: Clicking outside of the element or pressing esc key will not deactivate it.

v-menu/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-menu/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

v-menu/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

v-menu/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

v-menu/open-on-click.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator click.

v-menu/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether menu should open on activator hover.

v-menu/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

v-menu/close-on-content-click.description: Designates if menu should close when its content is clicked.

v-menu/close-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before closing component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

v-menu/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only works with the **open-on-hover** prop.

v-menu/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-menu/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-menu/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-menu/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-menu/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component. Use `auto` to use the activator width.

v-menu/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-menu/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-menu/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

v-menu/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

v-menu/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

v-menu/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

v-menu/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

v-menu/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-menu/transition.type:
| { component: Component }
  | string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
v-menu/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-menu/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default. Generally not recommended except as a last resort: the default positioning algorithm should handle most scenarios better than is possible without teleporting, and you may have unexpected behavior if the menu ends up as child of its activator.

v-messages/active.description: Determines whether the messages are visible or not.

v-messages/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-messages/messages.description: Displays a list of messages or a single message if using a string.

v-messages/transition.type:
| { component: Component; leaveAbsolute: boolean; group: boolean }
  | string
  | boolean
  | (TransitionProps & { component: Component })
v-messages/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-navigation-drawer/color.description: Applies specified color to the control - supports utility colors (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (for example `success` or `purple`) or css color (`#033` or `rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)`). Find a list of built-in classes on the [colors page](/styles/colors#material-colors).

v-navigation-drawer/disable-resize-watch.description: Prevents the automatic opening or closing of the drawer when resized, based on whether the device is mobile or desktop.

v-navigation-drawer/disable-route-watche.description: Disables opening of navigation drawer when route changes.

v-navigation-drawer/expand-on-hover.description: Collapses the drawer to a **mini-variant** until hovering with the mouse.

v-navigation-drawer/floating.description: A floating drawer has no visible container (no border-right).

v-navigation-drawer/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-navigation-drawer/permanent.description: The drawer remains visible regardless of screen size.

v-navigation-drawer/rail.description: Sets the component width to the **rail-width** value.

v-navigation-drawer/rail-width.description: Sets the width for the component when `rail` is enabled.

v-navigation-drawer/scrim.description: Determines whether an overlay is used when a **temporary** drawer is open. Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-navigation-drawer/temporary.description: A temporary drawer sits above its application and uses a scrim (overlay) to darken the background.

v-navigation-drawer/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-navigation-drawer/mobile-breakpoint.description: Sets the designated mobile breakpoint for the component. This will apply alternate styles for mobile devices such as the `temporary` prop, or activate the `bottom` prop when the breakpoint value is met. Setting the value to `0` will disable this functionality.

v-navigation-drawer/elevation.description: Designates an elevation applied to the component between 0 and 24. You can find more information on the [elevation page](/styles/elevation).

v-navigation-drawer/name.description: Assign a specific name for layout registration.

v-navigation-drawer/order.description: Adjust the order of the component in relation to its registration order.

v-navigation-drawer/rounded.description: Designates the **border-radius** applied to the component. You can find more information on the [Border Radius page](/styles/border-radius).

v-navigation-drawer/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-navigation-drawer/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-otp-input/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

A value of `desktop` *always* displays arrows on Desktop while a value of `mobile` always displays arrows on Mobile. A value of `always` always displays arrows on Desktop *and* Mobile. Find more information on how to customize breakpoint thresholds on the [breakpoints page](/customizing/breakpoints).

The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

| 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy'

v-snackbar/open-delay.description: Milliseconds to wait before opening component. Only applies to hover and focus events.

The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

v-toolbar-title/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-tooltip/id.description: HTML id attribute of the tooltip overlay. If not set, a globally unique id will be used.

v-tooltip/text.description: Specify content text for the component.

v-tooltip/close-on-back.description: Closes the overlay content when the browser's back button is pressed or `$router.back()` is called, cancelling the original navigation. `persistent` overlays will cancel navigation and animate as if they were clicked outside instead of closing.

v-tooltip/contained.description: Limits the size of the component and scrim to its offset parent. Implies `absolute` and `attach`. (Note: The parent element must have position: relative.).

v-tooltip/content-class.description: Applies a custom class to the detached element. This is useful because the content is moved to the beginning of the `v-app` component (unless the **attach** prop is provided) and is not targetable by classes passed directly on the component.

v-tooltip/content-props.description: Apply custom properties to the content.

v-tooltip/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

v-tooltip/no-click-animation.description: Disables the bounce effect when clicking outside of the content element when using the persistent prop.

v-tooltip/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-tooltip/scrim.description: Accepts true/false to enable background, and string to define color.

v-tooltip/z-index.description: The z-index used for the component.

v-tooltip/target.description: For locationStrategy="connected", specify an element or array of x,y coordinates that the overlay should position itself relative to. This will be the activator element by default.

v-tooltip/activator-props.description: Apply custom properties to the activator.

v-tooltip/open-on-click.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator click.

v-tooltip/open-on-hover.description: Designates whether the tooltip should open on activator hover.

v-tooltip/open-on-focus.description: Activate the component when the activator is focused.

v-tooltip/close-on-content-click.description: Closes component when you click on its content.

v-tooltip/close-delay.description: Delay (in ms) after which menu closes (when open-on-hover prop is set to true).

v-tooltip/open-delay.description: Delay (in ms) after which tooltip opens (when `open-on-hover` prop is set to **true**).

v-tooltip/height.description: Sets the height for the component.

v-tooltip/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-tooltip/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-tooltip/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-tooltip/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-tooltip/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-tooltip/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.

v-tooltip/location-strategy.description: A function used to specifies how the component should position relative to its activator.

v-tooltip/location.description: Specifies the anchor point for positioning the component, using directional cues to align it either horizontally, vertically, or both..

v-tooltip/origin.description: Sets the transition origin on the element. You can find more information on the MDN documentation [for transition origin](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform-origin).

v-tooltip/offset.description: A single value that offsets content away from the target based upon what side it is on.

v-tooltip/scroll-strategy.description: Strategy used when the component is activate and user scrolls.

v-tooltip/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-tooltip/transition.description: Sets the component transition. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-tooltip/attach.description: Specifies which DOM element the overlay content should teleport to. Can be a direct element reference, querySelector string, or `true` to disable teleporting. Uses `body` by default.

v-validation/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

v-validation/error.description: Puts the input in a manual error state.

v-validation/error-messages.description: Puts the input in an error state and passes through custom error messages. Will be combined with any validations that occur from the **rules** prop. This field will not trigger validation.

v-validation/max-errors.description: Control the maximum number of shown errors from validation.

v-validation/label.description: Sets the text of the [v-label](/api/v-label/) or [v-field-label](/api/v-field-label/) component.

v-validation/rules.description: Accepts a mixed array of types `function`, `boolean` and `string`. Functions pass an input value as an argument and must return either `true` / `false` or a `string` containing an error message. The input field will enter an error state if a function returns (or any value in the array contains) `false` or is a `string`.

v-validation/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-validation/validate-on.type:
| 'blur'
  | 'input'
  | 'submit'
  | 'blur lazy'
  | 'input lazy'
  | 'submit lazy'
  | 'lazy blur'
  | 'lazy input'
  | 'lazy submit'
  | 'lazy'
v-validation/validate-on.description: Change what type of event triggers validation to run.

v-validation/validation-value.description: The value used when applying validation rules.

v-validation/focused.description: Forces a focused state styling on the component.

v-virtual-scroll/items.description: The array of items to display.

v-virtual-scroll/item-height.description: Height in pixels of each item to display.

v-virtual-scroll/height.description: Height of the component as a css value/

v-virtual-scroll/max-height.description: Sets the maximum height for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/max-width.description: Sets the maximum width for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/min-height.description: Sets the minimum height for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/min-width.description: Sets the minimum width for the component.

v-virtual-scroll/width.description: Sets the width for the component.

v-window/continuous.description: If `true`, window will "wrap around" from the last item to the first, and from the first item to the last.

v-window/next-icon.description: Icon used for the "next" button if `show-arrows` is `true`.

v-window/prev-icon.description: Icon used for the "prev" button if `show-arrows` is `true`.

v-window/touch.description: Provide a custom **left** and **right** function when swiped left or right.

v-window/direction.description: The transition direction when changing windows.

v-window/model-value.description: The v-model value of the component. If component supports the **multiple** prop, this defaults to an empty array.

v-window/disabled.description: Removes the ability to click or target the component.

v-window/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-window/mandatory.description: Forces at least one item to always be selected (if available).

v-window/tag.description: Specify a custom tag used on the root element.

v-window/theme.description: Specify a theme for this component and all of its children.

v-window-item/transition.description: The transition used when the component progressing through items. Can be one of the [built in](/styles/transitions/) or custom transition.

v-window-item/value.description: The value used when the component is selected in a group. If not provided, a unique ID will be used.

v-window-item/disabled.description: Prevents the item from becoming active when using the "next" and "prev" buttons or the `toggle` method.

v-window-item/selected-class.description: Configure the active CSS class applied when an item is selected.

v-window-item/eager.description: Forces the component's content to render when it mounts. This is useful if you have content that will not be rendered in the DOM that you want crawled for SEO.
